item.title: The Death of the Data Monolith: An Introduction to Data Mesh
item.description:
The People Problem of Data Platforms

In my previous post, I discussed how the Lakehouse architecture addresses the technical gaps between Data Lakes and Warehouses. But even with state-of-the-art components, will we automatically have a successful data platform? OF COURSE NOT!

Engineering is easy compared to people. Who is responsible for which part? How does the organization scale as the business scales? These are critical questions an architect must answer before the wrong structure defines the architecture for them (the Conway’s Law reverse maneuver).
